result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel and Attorney McDougal in court for Matthew Ryan Hastings.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Forehand states the joint agreement to enter a plea:
2020CM000098- Count 2; costs only; Count 1 and 3 DRI
2021CF000149 - Count 1;Amended to a MU Theft- 2 years probation
                            Count 2 & 3 DRI
2021CM000113 - Count 1; 2 years probation, Forfeit $150 cash bond; Count 3 - 60 days in the county jail consecutive. All other counts DRI.
2021CM000175 - Count 1; Theft MU; 2 years probation and forfeits $250 cash bond. All other counts DRI
2022CF000032 - Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 - 2 years DPA on Count 1 -Felony Charge - found guilty, 2 years probation on MU counts on 
2022CM000042 - Count 1 ; 90 days in the county jail, consecutive to any other counts.
2022TR000178 - Defendant enters a plea of NC and orders fine.

And DRI: 2022CF000035, 2021CM000136, 2021CM000174, 2019CT000039, 2022CM000037, 2022TR000177, 2022TR000179, 2022TR000180, 2022TR000181


Court will find the defendant guilty. Court colloquy. Closing comments. Attorney Angel and Attorney McDougal asks for a stay of jail. State objects stay. Attorney McDougal asks that the bond be amended to a signature bond in the 22CF32. Court denies stay of jail time. 

Court will follow the joint agreement and orders:

2020CM000098- Count 2; costs only; Count 1 and 3 DRI
2021CF000149 - Count 1;Amended to a MU Theft- 2 years probation - 
                            Count 2 & 3 DRI
2021CM000113 - Count 1; 2 years probation, Forfeit $150 cash bond; Count 3 - 60 days in any jail that will take him in Wisconsin, consecutive  with huber to go to a job or find a job. . All other counts DRI. 16 days credit.
2021CM000175 - Count 1; Theft MU; 2 years probation and forfeits $250 cash bond. All other counts DRI - 4 days credit
2022CF000032 - Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 - 2 years DPA on Count 1 -Felony Charge - found guilty, 2 years probation on MU counts on - no credit
Bond amended to a signature bond instead of a cash bond.
2022CM000042 - Count 1 ; 90 days in any jail that will take him in  the State of Wisconsin, consecutive to any other counts with huber to go to a job or find a job. Credit 36 days.
2022TR000178 - Defendant enters a plea of NC and orders forfeiture.

Conditions of Probation on all counts that order probation:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; obey all rules and regulations of the department. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
Restitution to be paid to victims - parties have 30 days to stipulate.
Anger management counseling or any counseling that is ordered by probation.
AODA/ Driver Safety plan.

Court waives court costs.

And DRI: 2022CF000035, 2021CM000136, 2021CM000174, 2019CT000039, 2022CM000037, 2022TR000177, 2022TR000179, 2022TR000180, 2022TR000181

Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:13 PM 22CF32/ 22CF35/ 22CM37/ 22CM42 -Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Attorney McDougal asks that the preliminary hearing and the other cases be reset. Attorney McDougal states that she has received an offer from the state to close all cases and notes that some are represented by Attorney Angel.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on March 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:13 PM  22CM37/22CM42/22CF32/22CF35 - Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appears by video. Attorney McDougal or MH havn't seen the complaing and asks for an adjourn initial appearance in 22CM35. Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading on all other complaints in 22CM37/22CM42/22CF32. Max penalties stated. 22CF32 will be scheduled at a preliminary hearing for March 28 at 1 PM. No plea has been enters in the CM cases.

Attorney McDougal speaks about bond in 22CF32 and 22CM42. Attorney McDougal asks for a bond reduction. State comments about all the open cases and object to reducing bond. Court denies bond reduction.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:30 PM 19CT39, 20CM98, 21CF149, 21CM113, 21CM136, 21CM174, 21CM175, 22CF32, 22CM37, 22CM42 and unfiled -  Attorney McDougal appears for the defendant on 22CF32 and 22CM42. Defendant Matthew Ryan Hastings appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal would  like to speak about  bond. Attorney McDougal asks that the unfiled case be converted to a signature bond and that the 22CF32 and 22CM42 be converted to a lower cash instead. Court denies bond mo. Court converts the unfiled bond to a signature bond. Court set next date for 03/21/22 at 1 pm with a CC.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
